channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023090036
item.description:
Report X-2023090036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FIBERBOARD BOX WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND BOX WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023090035
item.description:
Report X-2023090035

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FIBERBOARD BOX WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND BOX WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. BOX WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE DECONTAMINATED AND BOX WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023081808
item.description:
Report X-2023081808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was brought to QA to be run through HAP, I noticed that the bottom of the package was wet. I immediately set it aside in a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: Package contains a jug of ZEP CONCENTRATED INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER & CLEANER. The handle on the top of the jug has been forced inward and the plastic around the handle has cracked. This has allowed some of the contents to spill out into the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed and set aside.

item.title: Report E-2023090530
item.description:
Report E-2023090530

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: RENTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon pail of pronto 13 (un1247) had been damaged by other freight and had released 2 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090378
item.description:
Report E-2023090378

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the poly 55 gallon drums of 2nd step copper and zinc solution (un3082) had a loose cap not tightened down prior to shipment had released 1 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

Report X-2023082002

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER REPORTED THE LEAKING HAZMAT AND LEFT THE TRAILER. PROPER PPE WAS DONNED AND THE PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED IN THE TRAILER. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023081235
item.description:
Report X-2023081235

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the trailer was opened the package handler noticed that the hazmat package was wet. QA and Managers were called to determine what the package is. Package was placed into a tote lined with a hazmat bag and taken to QA. DescribePack: Both caps have a small hole the size of a needle on top of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a tote lined with a bag.

item.title: Report X-2023081175
item.description:
Report X-2023081175

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: SPOKANE VALLEY
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was brought to QA wet. Upon inspection it was discovered that one of the bags of hand santizer had been punctured, leaking its contents into the box. DescribePack: whole on side DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a red hazmat tote with liner

item.title: Report X-2023081130
item.description:
Report X-2023081130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer and the package handler noticed the box was leaking and placed the box on the ground. QA was called and placed the package in a tote lined with a bag. DescribePack: Cap was loose at the top of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cap was tightened to prevent further leakage. Package was placed in a tote lined with a bag.
